name: Islamic Educational Foundation
mission: ESTABLISH AND OPERATE PRE-SCHOOL, ELEMENTARY, HIGH SCHOOL.
theoryOfChange: The Islamic Educational Foundation (IEF Schools) outlines its strategic framework through its Mission, Vision, and Core Values. Their mission is to "cultivate civic-minded, professionally successful, God-conscious Muslim leaders". Their vision is to become a premier academic institution by "simultaneously instilling Islamic Character while ranking in the top decile in STEM and the Arts". The core values that guide their approach are Faith, Character, Dignity & Respect. They emphasize character development by instilling prophetic character, promoting kindness, teamwork, and ethical decision-making to empower students to make a positive impact. The schools also focus on the holistic growth of the child, encompassing character, social, emotional, and academic skills. Furthermore, they employ a "Modern Classroom" methodology, which is a research-backed instructional model incorporating blended instruction, self-paced structures, and mastery-based grading to address individual student needs.

evaluationSources: School of Excellence Award (mentioned for board member's previous school)
Accreditation reviews (mentioned via board member's role as lead evaluator)

The organizations found are primarily focused on educational activities.

dimension_explanations.alignment: With an alignment score of 22/50, the organization serves a specific religious and cultural niche in New Jersey, though it may have lower general donor fit compared to broader humanitarian causes [1]. The foundation facilitates charitable giving through its website, focusing on general sadaqah to support its educational mission [3].
dimension_explanations.impact: The foundation demonstrates a capacity-building model by maintaining physical school infrastructure, though its impact score of 21/50 reflects a lack of specific cost-per-beneficiary data [1]. While it maintains a healthy 16.3 months of working capital, the program expense ratio is 71.5%, indicating a portion of funds is directed toward administrative or secondary costs [2].

strengths: High fundraising efficiency with $0.00 spent per $1 raised
Strong liquidity with 16.3 months of working capital available
baseline_narrative.summary: The Islamic Education Foundation of New Jersey Inc is a non-profit organization dedicated to establishing and operating pre-school, elementary, and high school institutions [1]. The foundation manages Al-Ghazaly High School and Al-Hikmah Elementary School, supported by a total revenue of $4,637,834 [2]. Donors can contribute to these educational initiatives through various sadaqah-eligible giving methods [3].

impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The foundation creates impact by providing a structured K-12 environment that integrates <cite id="1">standard academic curricula with Islamic and Quranic studies</cite> to produce religiously literate and academically competitive graduates.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that the dual-curriculum model effectively prepares students for both higher education and religious life.

strengths.detail: The foundation operates with maximum efficiency in its development efforts, spending <cite id="7">$0.00 per $1 raised</cite> in public support.
The organization maintains <cite id="11">16.3 months of working capital</cite>, providing significant stability for its school operations.
The school system is <cite id="12">Cognia certified</cite> and has been recognized as a <cite id="13">Nationally Top 20% Private STEM High School</cite>.

strengths_deep_dive: The Islamic Education Foundation of New Jersey demonstrates a robust financial trajectory with a <cite id="14">3-year revenue CAGR of 12.5%</cite>, growing from $3.6 million in 2021 to over $4.6 million in 2023. This growth is supported by a strong balance sheet featuring <cite id="15">$5,926,529 in total assets</cite> against minimal <cite id="16">liabilities of $97,445</cite>. Its operational model is highly direct, with a <cite id="17">71.5% program expense ratio</cite> reported in its most recent financial filings, ensuring that all expenditures are directed toward its core mission of <cite id="1">establishing and operating educational institutions</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: The Islamic Education Foundation of New Jersey Inc (IEF) is a long-standing educational institution that has been <cite id="1">operating pre-school, elementary, and high school programs</cite> since its <cite id="2">founding in 1983</cite>. The foundation serves as the governing body for <cite id="3">Al-Ghazaly High School and Al-Hikmah Elementary School</cite>, providing a dual curriculum of academic and religious instruction. In the 2023 fiscal year, the organization reported <cite id="4">total revenue of $4,637,834</cite>, which is primarily driven by <cite id="5">$4,279,911 in program service revenue</cite>, reflecting a sustainable model based on tuition and educational services rather than sole reliance on public donations. The organization maintains a <cite id="6">71.5% independent board of directors</cite> and demonstrates exceptional fundraising efficiency, reporting <cite id="7">$0.00 spent to raise every $1</cite> in contribution income. Academically, the foundation's schools utilize <cite id="8">MAP Testing twice annually</cite> to track student progress and ensure instructional quality over a <cite id="9">179-day academic calendar</cite>.
